lexUnit.name: melt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become liquefied by heating.

sentence.text: 1 Heat the oil and butter together in a pan and when the butter has melted , toss in the beans .
There would be potato scones for tea , split down the middle , butter melting in their golden hearts , and probably jam tarts , for Aunt Margaret was making pastry .
They had always made toast in the winter evenings , stretching that long brass fork towards the log fire , holding each other close while butter melted and bread scorched to cinders .
She may look like a fire-breathing dragon , but butter would n't melt in her mouth .
Butter melted to liquid in half an hour if left out of the fridge .
Remove the foil and cook for a further 50 to 10 min , until the cheese has melted and the trout is cooked .
It makes superb cheese on toast because it melts very easily .
Stand the bowl over a pan of simmering water and heat very gently until the chocolate begins to melt .
Stand the bowl over a pan of simmering water and heat gently until the chocolate begins to melt .
The chocolate will melt and start to spread .
Fairbanks found that when sea level first began to rise as the ice sheets melted , 17,000 years ago , it did so at a rate of about 4mm per year .
When the ice melted the moraine was dumped as sheets of boulder clay ( clay mixed with sand , stones and boulders ) on the floors of valleys .
When the ice melted some shallow lakes remained where boulder clay blocked old river courses .
The short-term climatic fluctuations of the Pleistocene have resulted in rapid world-wide ( or eustatic ) falls and rises of sea level as polar ice has alternately frozen and melted .
Scientists believe that if something is not done about this problem , glacial ice will melt raising the level of the sea and flooding vast areas of low-lying land .
Outside the snow was already melting on the slate roofs of the houses .
Most of the snow had melted here .
To keep the temperature low , a skylight in the ceiling had been opened a crack ; a few flakes of snow drifted about the room before melting .
A spokesman for the National Rivers Authority said the city could face further problems if the snow on higher ground begins to melt quickly .
Temperatures in the upper Tay valleys rose to an unseasonal 12C and in the high glens , millions of tonnes of fresh snow began to melt .
Saalbach has been cancelled because the artificial snow at the bottom of the course has melted .
During the later stages of accretion , at the very least , the outer 100 km or so of the Moon melted , large areas being molten at the same time .
A snowflake touched the glass , stuck there for a moment then melted .
The Moon , in contrast , melted almost completely soon after it formed but cooled rather quickly .
Soldering must be carried out with great care , noting that most ties will melt instantly if touched by a soldering iron or molten solder .
Why should the North American glaciers have melted so irregularly ?
Plastic Lunch boxes , food storage containers , etc , may melt if stacked close to the heating elements .
